intro: Leucopogon breviflorus, commonly known as the narrow-flower heath, is a flowering plant native to western Australia. It is a member of the Ericaceae family, which includes heaths and heather. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in coastal and inland heathlands. Its small, tubular flowers are usually pink or white, and it blooms during the spring and summer months. Leucopogon breviflorus is adapted to dry conditions and is often found in open, sun-exposed areas.
